exception.impl: The implementation used cannot create LayerswitcherControl.
exception.extent: Cannot get the extent of the layer
exception.capabilities: An error has occurred in obtaining the GetCapabilities document
exception.ogcfeatures: The provided url does not correspond to a valid layer type
exception.no_http_https: No http or https services allowed
exception.valid_url: You must provide a valid URL
exception.select_layer: You must select at least one layer
exception.no_results: No layers found in this service
exception.codsi: An error occurred while consulting the CODSI catalog
exception.codsi_no_results: There are no results for your search

textHelp.help1: The layer selector extension allows you to manage the layers displayed in a cartographic viewer.
textHelp.help2: This extension is customizable via parameters, so the extension can change from one viewer to another.
textHelp.help3: The different tools available in the layer selector are:
textHelp.help5: The first option is to enter the URL of a service in the text box. To do this, start from the IDEE services directory (https://www.idee.es/segun-tipo-de-servicio ) for example, using the Historical Satellite Mosaics service of Spain (https://wms-satelites-historicos.idee.es/satelites-historicos). When you click the search magnifying glass, a list of available layers appears in the service. In this example, we choose the 'filomena' layer and add:
textHelp.help6: If you wanted more layers, you could select as many as you wanted. Once added, we would have the following appearance in the viewer:
textHelp.help7: Another way to load layers is from the IDEE service catalog (https://www.idee.es/csw-inspire-idee/srv/spa/catalog.search#/home). Click On the binoculars button, another text search engine and a list of possibilities will appear. For example, if we search for 'IGN administrative units'
textHelp.help8: and we click on 'WMS of Administrative Units of Spain', we can load the layers of the searched service:
textHelp.help9: Finally, layers can be loaded from a list of some available layers, which is configured by theme. In the example shown, the first edition of MTN 50 that is in cartography will be loaded:
textHelp.help10: The service layer selector will appear again, and the first edition of MTN 50 is marked and added to the map:
textHelp.help11: Once the layers are loaded into the map, you can work with them from the layer selector.
textHelp.help12: The first functionality would be to turn on the layers, this can be done from the yellow eye button that allows you to turn all of them on and off, or from the different green-red eye buttons to turn on or off just one layer:
textHelp.help13: Another functionality would be to delete the layer, from the trash can button.
textHelp.help14: Within the options of a visible layer, you have the tools to add transparency to the layer:
textHelp.help16: center the viewer to the extent of the layer:
textHelp.help18: and if the layer allows it, be able to apply another cartographic style:
textHelp.help19: The information relevant to the extension and its possible parameterization is documented in
textHelp.help20: The example of use of its parameters can be checked in

url_service: Include URL of the service to load
title: Title
name: Name
drag_drop: Drag and drop to change display order
see_more_layer: View more information about the layer (Metadata)
warning: WARNING: High limits are not recommended
custom_query_warning: WARNING: Filtering by "More filters" it is based on a draft standard. The result of the query may not be as desired.
